monogr.title: An introduction for to lerne to recken with the pen : or with the counters, accordyng to the trewe cast of algorisme, in hole numbers or in broken, newly corrected. And certayne notable and goodly rules of false positions thereunto added, not before sene in our Englyshe tonge, by the which all maner of difficile questions may easely be dissolued and assoyled. Anno. 1546

div.head: To the reader.
div.p:
THat arte and feate (deare reader, whome vtilite and necessite bothe do commende, neadeth greately of no other cōmendation. Howe profitable and necessarye this feat of Algorisme is, to all maner of persons, whiche haue rekenynges or accountes, other to make, or elles to receyue, nedeth no declaration. Neyther is this arte onely necessarye to those, but also in maner to all maner of sciences, and artificyes. For what crafte is that but it somtyme dothe occupye not onely one parte of this feate, but all the partes. And forbycause that dyuers rueles in this booke haue not ben in tymes paste, very cōmodiously expressed, and set forth, and many examples, mo then nedid a greate sorte coheaped together. Therfore paynes haue ben taken bothe in the better and more clearer declaration and expressynge of the sayd rules: and also in the resectynge and cuttynge of dyuers superfluouse & voyde thynges, rather hynderance
to the dyligent reader, than fortherance. Forthermore there is added the rules of false posytions, the whiche howe conuenient and profitable they be to the readye solution of all harde & mysty questyons: when ye haue redde theym then iudge. Nowe thenne ye shall vnderstand that in this arte there are .vii. necessarye and distinct partes to be knowen. Numeration, Addicion, Subtractiō, Multiplycation, Partition, Progrestion, and Reduction. Of the which .vii. hereafter shall be syngularly entracted of eche of theym in theyr chapters. But I aduertyse you fyrst to begynne at the fyrst parte, & then successyuely to the seconde, and thyrd. &c. lernynge euery parte by it selfe exactely, as they be set forth in this boke: for if you lepe to the seconde part, before you haue perfectly the fyrst, or to the thyrde, before you haue sene the second, you shal neuer prosper ne profette in this arte. Vale.
